Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from six fragments with added plaster) of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with turn to handle zone; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired reddish); traces of three sets of added red bands lined in white; exterior: narrow black band at rim above chevron frieze and dilute line; below, dilute brown line; below, panel with elaborate triple guilloche, bounded on the elft by two vertical strips, one with remnants of maeander square the other with hook maeanders; below, reddish brown band at junction of body with handle zone; inscription on exterior.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 722, pl. XXI, no. 722)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 678, no. 373)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0064) (phase 2)
Condition: Bernand includes a fragment with ]dit[ fragment, not now with sherds. This seems not to be 'straight' Chian.
